s.text: He uses PR brilliantly: Hill and Knowlton tout him relentlessly to reporters and investors, winning him an adulatory profile that serves him well.
He served as right-hand man/enforcer for both Australian media magnate Kerry Packer and recently deceased British billionaire Sir James Goldsmith.
He prettifies struggling companies for Wall Street, but undermines them in the long term.
In late 1995, he sold Scott to Kimberly-Clark for $9.
